main event: A bright object, as bright as a first magnitude star, was observed in the vicinity of Yokohama, Japan, on August 31, 1960.
interesting points: The object had an erratic course, leading to speculation that it might be a balloon or unidentified object., Several reports were received from the area, indicating possible widespread sightings., The weather conditions were clear at the time of the sighting., The object appeared rectangular in shape during part of the observation., The conclusion of the report indicated the possibility of it being a military flare or an unknown balloon.
sighted object: one bright object in the sky
